title: Move Zeroes

articles.title: Move all Zeros to the end of the array

patternTriggers: In-place array modification + partition = Two Pointers. Partition non-zeros to left, zeros to right.

approaches.name: Brute Force (Extra Space)
approaches.intuition: Create a new array, copy all non-zero elements first, then fill remaining positions with zeros.
approaches.approach: Use temporary array to collect non-zeros, then copy back to original array and fill rest with zeros.
steps: Create temporary array of same size
Iterate through original array, copy non-zero elements to temp
Copy temp array back to original

approaches.name: Better (Two Pass)
approaches.intuition: First pass: move all non-zeros to front. Second pass: fill remaining positions with zeros.
approaches.approach: Use index to track position for non-zeros. After placing all non-zeros, fill rest with zeros.
steps: If element != 0, place at nums[index] and increment index
Second pass: fill positions from index to end with 0

approaches.name: Two Pointers - Optimal (Single Pass)
approaches.intuition: Use slow pointer to track position for next non-zero. Fast pointer finds non-zeros. Swap when found, maintaining relative order.
approaches.approach: Slow pointer marks position for non-zero placement. Fast scans and swaps non-zeros to slow position in single pass.
steps: After loop, all non-zeros at front, zeros at end

commonMistakes: Using extra space for new array
Not maintaining relative order of non-zero elements
Forgetting to swap - only copying loses relative order
hints: Think of it as partitioning: non-zeros left, zeros right
Swap instead of just copying to maintain order in single pass
Slow pointer tracks where next non-zero should go
All zeros automatically move to end when non-zeros move left
followUp: What if we want zeros at the beginning?
Can you count total swaps performed?
What if array contains negative numbers?
